title: State of the Union: Obama: 'I still believe that we are one people' âÂ as it happened | US news | The Guardian
summary: ernst : 'serious work in this new congress '

text: the clock has struck midnight ( where we live ) .

here 's a summary of where things stand : announcing that the shadow of crisis has passed , president barack obama used his sixth state of the union speech to tout economic progress and call for a recovery that would include americans who are still fighting off poverty .
the president described a vision for a middle-class economics with an emphasis on good jobs , savings , education , affordable housing and support for families .
but the president declared economic victory after years of sluggish growth .
the verdict is clear .
middle-class economics works , he said .
expanding opportunity works .
obama outlined initiatives to give workers longer paid sick leave and maternity leave , better child-care support and to offer students two free years of community college .
obama called for tax reform , saying the tax code was rigged with loopholes created by corporate lobbyists and superrich interests .
the president called on congress to pass legislation to increase cybersecurity .
on foreign policy , the president asked congress for an authorization of the use of military force to sustain the fight against isis .
he said he would veto new sanctions on iran .
obama asked for trade promotion authority to cut strong new trade deals from asia to europe .
the president called out republicans for climate change denial , saying the best scientists in the world are all telling us that our activities are changing the climate .
obama made passing reference to the events of ferguson and new york , calling on all sides to seek common ground .
obama warned congress not to try to roll back his work on immigration , health care or financial regulation , saying any such bill would earn my veto .
the president called the country a family .
we are a strong , tight-knit family who has made it through some very , very hard times , he said .
read the full 2015 state of the union address here .
senator joni ernst delivered a response on behalf of republicans , calling on obama to cooperate and promising , you 'll see a lot of serious work in this new congress .
here 's one of the few unscripted moments of the evening : i have no more campaigns to run i know 'cause i won both of them .
i won both of them .

as reaction to the speech continues to unfold , some analysts seem to be looking ahead as much as behind : kay steiger ( @ kaysteiger ) rand paul utters words tonight you 'll hear a lot of : `` hillary 's war in libya ¦ # benghazi seperately , guardian social news editor kayla epstein notes that # breadbags is currently one of the top trending terms in the us on twitter , after senator joni ernst 's anecdote about wearing them as a child to keep her feet dry in winter .
update : here 's senator elizabeth warren of massachusetts , praising the speech : kevin cirilli ( @ kevcirilli ) elizabeth warren has high praise for obama 's # sotu .
her statement :
obama has returned to the white house , according to a pool report .
this state of the union is cooked .

here now is a sampler of reactions to tonight 's speech : the washington post 's chris cillizza heard a supremely confident president : from start to finish , obama was supremely confident , challenging - and mocking - republicans at every turn .

touting the turnaround of the economy , obama turned to republicans , who , in classic state of the union symbolism , had refused to deliver a standing ovation , and joked that 's good news , people .
on cuba , obama challenged those who disagreed with his administration policies ; when what you 're doing does n't work for fifty years , it 's time to try something new , he said .

republican national committee chairman reince priebus says obama is n't listening : as the last election made clear , americans want a less intrusive government that spends their money responsibly , yet tonight president obama gave another speech calling for more taxes and more spending .

americans who listened to president obama likely feel president obama is n't listening to them the national journal 's ron fournier does n't share the audacity of obama 's continued hope : he acknowledged there is good reason for cynicism .
but i still think the cynics are wrong .
does he really ?
after six years of blaming the gop and accusing pundits of overstating his ability to change washington , obama still has the audacity to hope ?
i doubt it .
if there is any hope , it 's in the states , where there is still some level of cooperation between gop and democratic leaders .

and there was this from a certain former governor of massachusetts : mitt romney ( @ mittromney ) true to form , the president in his state of the union speech is more interested in politics than in leadership # sotu

to give working families a fair shot , we 'll still need more employers to see beyond next quarter 's earnings and recognize that investing in their workforce is in their company 's long-term interest .

these may be the single most important words the president spoke in his address , writes guardian commentator suzanne mcgee : obama needs to prove that policy can still play a role in addressing income inequality , but he ca n't create well-paid jobs that will put americans in the middle class .
only corporations can do that .

and if there is one statement here that everyone should consider seriously , it is this : to what extent is the corporate focus on delivering profits to investors ( a too-small subset of americans who can afford to save and invest , given the ongoing struggle to make ends meet and the inability to set money aside from skimpy wages to invest ) at odds with the country 's social and economic policy goals .
and how can those two be brought closer together ?

we need the new economy to keep churning out high-wage jobs for our workers to fill , the president went on to say , noting the importance of everything from infrastructure investments to negotiating trade rules .
but ultimately , if a company 's goal is to cut costs to the bone and maximize profits , job creation and wages will be byproducts , not objectives , as they are for the government .
and that 's the conundrum .
video : no challenge poses a greater threat to future generations than climate change .
( read the extended passage here . )
( thanks @ twitterid )
guardian environment correspondent suzanne goldenberg tests senator ernst 's claims for the keystone xl pipeline against the truth and finds they do n't stand up .

evidently , joni ernst has n't read any of the many fact-checks exposing the republicans ' inflated claims about the economic benefits of the keystone xl pipeline because she trotted out the demonstrably false thousands of jobs line in the gop response , suzanne writes : the non-partisan congressional research service has found the pipeline would create only a few dozen jobs .
ernst , however , introduced the topic as the keystone jobs bill never mentioning the word pipeline .
unsurprisingly , ernst did not mention president obama 's state of the union comments on climate change scientists , which is not altogether surprising .
ernst has said in the past she does n't know the science about climate change which makes her one of the republicans the president was mocking tonight .
question for senator marco rubio : who are you wearing tonight .
huh ?
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) marco rubio and some cutting edge political reporting from the huffington post .
here 's the i still believe section of the speech , via the white house 's enhanced video feed .
( full speech here . )
with a wink and a smiiile
ernst is done .
that came off without a hitch .

documents.title: ernst : 'serious work in this new congress '
text: ernst concludes by touting the work the republican majority of the 114th congress has planned : the new republican congress you elected is working to make washington understand that too .
and with a little cooperation from the president , we can get washington working again .
thank you for allowing me to speak with you tonight .

may god bless this great country of ours , the brave americans serving in uniform on our behalf , and you , the hardworking men and women who make the united states of america the greatest nation the world has ever known .
is this repetition of we 'll an effective rhetorical device or a speechwriter just phoning it in ?
ernst says : we 'll also keep fighting to repeal and replace a healthcare law that 's hurt so many hardworking families .
we 'll work to correct executive overreach .
we 'll propose ideas that aim to cut wasteful spending and balance the budget with meaningful reforms , not higher taxes like the president has proposed .
we 'll advance solutions to prevent the kind of cyber-attacks we 've seen recently .
we 'll work to confront iran 's nuclear ambitions .
the republicans are calling on the president to cooperate with them : let 's simplify america 's outdated and loophole-ridden tax code .
republicans think tax filing should be easier for you , not just the well-connected .
so let 's iron out loopholes to lower rates and create jobs , not pay for more government spending .
the president has already expressed some support for these kinds of ideas .
we 're calling on him now to cooperate to pass them .
ernst calls on obama to sign the keystone xl bill .
we worked with democrats to pass this bill through the house .
we 're doing the same now in the senate .
president obama will soon have a decision to make : will he sign the bill , or block good american jobs ?
the full text of ernst 's speech has been released .
you can find it here .
ernst looks confident and is speaking evenly .
for many of us frustration with washington 's dysfunction were n't something we had to read about .
we felt them every day .
she stumbled the littlest bit saying washington .
she 's describing growing in red oak , iowa .
growing up , i had only one good pair of shoes .
on rainy school days , my mom would slip plastic bread bags in them .
this is a story she told a lot on the campaign trail .
dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) first we have the policy speech without policy ; now we have the rebuttal without any response to the speech .
joni ernst tells story instead .

documents.title: republican reply begins
text: senator joni ernst of iowa is about to come on with the republican response .
there she is .
rather than respond to a speech , i 'd like to talk about your priorities , she says .
the guardian 's paul lewis watches republicans run for the exits : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) steve king , who made tonight 's `` deportable '' remark , slinks away without talking to reporters .
up next jennifer jacobs ( @ jenniferjjacobs ) check out the shoes iowa u.s. sen. joni ernst is wearing tonight for her state of the union rebuttal .
# sotu
u.s. president barack obama hugs u.s. supreme court associate justice ruth bader ginsburg before delivering his state of the union address .
roberts/reuters
heh .
ric andersen ( @ ricandersen ) you do n't have to go home , but you ca n't state of the union here .
obama apparently won few converts on the red side : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) republicans dash for the exit doors with almost indecent haste the second obama finishes .
i have rarely seen a more contemptuous opposition .
did you miss any of the speech ?
the full text , once again , is here .
the president is making his way away from the rostrum .
he 's wading into the congressional crowd for some chummery .

documents.title: obama concludes
text: here 's the end , and there 's the applause : fifteen years into this new century , we have ourselves up , dusted ourselves off , and begun again the work of remaking america .
we 've laid a new foundation .
a brighter future is ours to write .
let 's begin this new chapter together and let 's start the work right now .
thank you , god bless you , and god bless this country we love .

documents.title: obama : 'we are a strong family '
text: and now it 's back to rebekah and ben : i want them to grow up in a country where a young mom like rebekah can sit down and write a letter to her president with a story to sum up these past six years : it is amazing what you can bounce back from when you have to¦we are a strong , tight-knit family who has made it through some very , very hard times .
my fellow americans , we too are a strong , tight-knit family .
we , too , have made it through some hard times .
obama starts to wind up to a big finish .

he 's talking about future generations i want future generations to know that we are a people who see our differences as a great gift , that we are a people who value the dignity and worth of every citizen man and woman , young and old , black and white , latino and asian , immigrant and native american , gay and straight , americans with mental illness or physical disability .
a little commotion in the room as obama says , i have no more campaigns to run , and someone appears to ask how he knows that .
i know 'cause i won both of them , the president replies .
that was n't in the prepared text .
the president turns to ferguson , as excerpted earlier in the blog .

the guardian 's ed pilkington writes that after a year in which tensions over police shootings of black teenagers have boiled over onto the streets of us cities , president obama was muted in his state of the union comments on race and justice : he devoted just a few sentences of his address albeit at the end to the events of ferguson and new york , where the deaths of eric garner and michael brown sparked widespread protests .
he carefully counterpoised the anxieties of parents worried about the harassment faced by their children , with the worries of a police officer 's spouse .
the president reserved his most passionate words on race to the subject of voting rights , a to subject given the release of the movie selma , which the obamas screened at the white house on friday .

obama invoked the 50th anniversary of the march in selma , for which the white house announced on tuesday that the president will visit in march , to allude to the ongoing denial of the vote to too many people .
the president made no direct mention of the spate of voter suppression laws that have been introduced by many republican-controlled states .

obama says we still may not agree on a woman 's right to choose , but surely we can agree it 's a good thing that teen pregnancies and abortions are nearing all-time lows , and that every woman should have access to the health care she needs .
guardian columnist jessica valenti replies that president obama had feminists swooning with his promises on paid leave , affordable child care , and equal pay myself included .

but it 's disappointing that the only mention of abortion perhaps one of the most important and urgent women 's issue this year was a quick , exceedingly safe , line about how we agree it 's a good thing that abortion rates are nearing all-time lows .

considering the awful restrictions the gop has enacted against reproductive rights across the country , excuse me if i find it hard to celebrate the fact that too many women ca n't get the legal care they need .
we do n't need another safe , legal and rare moment for abortion rights - there 's nothing new , progressive , or interesting there .
and it 's certainly not a message that helps women .
the president did n't hesitate on saying what needed to be said on so many issues let 's not leave a crucial one out in the dust .

documents.title: obama : 'i still believe '
text: the president says he believes in national unity : i know how tempting such cynicism may be .
but i still think the cynics are wrong .
i still believe that we are one people .
i still believe that together , we can do great things , even when the odds are long .
i believe this because over and over in my six years in office , i have seen america at its best .
obama turns to government surveillance programs .
while some have moved on from the debates over our surveillance programs , i have n't , he says .
as promised , our intelligence agencies have worked hard , with the recommendations of privacy advocates , to increase transparency and build more safeguards against potential abuse .
and next month , we 'll issue a report on how we 're keeping our promise to keep our country safe while strengthening privacy .
guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman appraises the remarks .
in november , after a bill to restrict the national security agency 's bulk collection of us phone records failed , the white house told me it intended to revive the effort in 2015 .
if that 's still its intention , you could n't tell from the state of the union , spencer writes : obama said he has n't moved on from the debates over our surveillance programs .
but he did n't call upon congress to pass any new surveillance reforms .
instead , he said , next month we 'll issue a report on how we 're keeping our promise to keep our country safe while strengthening privacy .
but a progress report does not get the nsa out of the business of collecting domestic phone data in bulk .
nor does it restrain the federal bureau of investigation from accessing collected us communications data without a warrant or even a record of their searches .
some legislators say that absent reform , congress is likely to allow broader surveillance authorities to expire , and obama on tuesday offered no alternative .
here 's a true state of the union perennial : it 's time to close gitmo .

guardian washington correspondent paul lewis flags a moment from inside the room : as the president said we stand united with people around the world who 've been targeted by terrorists from a school in pakistan to the streets of paris , dozens of democratic lawmakers waved yellow pencils in solidarity with the french cartoonists murder in paris earlier this month .
paul writes : the moment came during obama 's brief and only reference to the attacks , when he criticised terrorists targeting people from a school in pakistan to the streets of paris .
it was a strange kind of a gesture .
they kind of just clapped and waved the pencils above their heads .
do n't think it quite worked , not least because the pencil-holders were peppered around the auditorium .

given the criticism the obama administration came under for its decision not to send a senior official to paris after the attacks , i 'm also surprised the president 's reference to the attacks was so glancing .
obama turns to climate change .
and no challenge no challenge poses a greater threat to future generations than climate change , he says .
2014 was the planet 's warmest year on record .
now , one year does n't make a trend , but this does 14 of the 15 warmest years on record have all fallen in the first 15 years of this century .

barack obama has used every big chance to stick it to republicans on climate denial , memorably using the term flat earth society at his big climate speech in june 2013 , writes guardian environment correspondent suzanne goldenberg .

tonight was no exception : the president ridiculed the republican party leadership for their new-ish i 'm not a scientist meme of avoiding the outright denial tag , and turned it against them , saying : i 'm not a scientist , either .
but you know what ?
i know a lot of really good scientists at nasa , and noaa , and at our major universities .
there were no new environmental initiatives in the speech that was hardly a surprise .
but obama put congress on notice : he is going to fight republican efforts to roll back climate measures at home or in international negotiations .
and while obama did n't actually utter the word keystone , he put out a strong signal that he intends to use that veto against the bill now moving through the senate .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) bill cassidy , senator for louisiana , much of which will be lost to climate change , smirking as obama talks about tackling global warming .
a supreme court justice is falling asleep : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) there is no polite way to say this : justice ruth bader ginsburg is being nudged awake by her colleagues
obama has just repeated his veto threat against any new iran sanctions : i will veto any new sanctions bill that threatens to undo this progress .

congressman david price agreed in a piece for guardian us on tuesday : the existing sanctions are , of course , a major reason that iran is at the negotiating table , and congress should stand ready to reimpose and strengthen them should iran violate the terms of the jpoa or any future nuclear agreement .
but taking punitive action now could send a message that congress does not stand behind the negotiators .
obama moves on to cuba , and then iran .
president obama is making a case for his foreign policy as a smarter ' approach to global leadership , the guardian 's spencer ackerman writes .
the big problem he has is that it 's not showing results .
spencer continues : russia 's economy may be in tatters , but vladimir putin 's forces remain in ukraine .
nuclear diplomacy is underway with iran , but a deal remains as elusive as massive congressional opposition is assured .
combat in afghanistan may be over for conventional forces , but not for counterterrorism operations .
obama has relaunched the war he pledged to end in iraq , and far from stopping isil 's advance , the islamic state is gaining territory .
obama had an unambiguous , historic win with the diplomatic thaw in cuba .
unless he produces more in 2015 , he risks discrediting the persistent , steady resolve in foreign affairs he 's touting .

obama has just boasted of not getting dragged into another ground war in the middle east : instead of americans patrolling the valleys of afghanistan , we 've trained their security forces , who 've now taken the lead , and we 've honored our troops ' sacrifice by supporting that country 's first democratic transition .
instead of sending large ground forces overseas , we 're partnering with nations from south asia to north africa to deny safe haven to terrorists who threaten america .
in iraq and syria , american leadership including our military power is stopping isil 's advance .
instead of getting dragged into another ground war in the middle east , we are leading a broad coalition , including arab nations , to degrade and ultimately destroy this terrorist group .
he did not mention , however , the air war : air war

now that the midterm elections are over and a chance for citizens to put the newest iraq war on the ballot has passed , writes guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman , president obama has called on congress to show the world that we are united in this mission by passing a resolution to authorize the use of force against the islamic state ( isis ) .
spencer continues : it 's an odd spectacle : the retroactive legislative blessing of a war .

when obama launched his airpower-led war against isis , his administration insisted a new authorization to use military force ( aumf ) was unnecessary , as it possessed all the legal authority it required by and choosing from previous aumfs .
( sometimes that required ignoring the schism between isis and al-qaeda . )
but on tuesday , obama declined to specify why he suddenly needs new powers , beyond the spectacle of showing american unity .
notably , obama did not set any parameters for the next-generation aumf .
should it have an expiration date ?
should it extend beyond iraq and syria ?
how will it define isis would the stupid , bored teenager tweeting support for the group be a target ?
all of these are critical issues for aumfs once passed , they tend not to be repealed and obama offered no guidance on how to address them .

it 's surprising that the speech contained pretty platitudinous stuff on the internet given obama has made such strong statements on net neutrality in recent weeks and pushed for municipalities to take on big cable in offering high speed internet access , writes the guardian 's dominic rushe : pretty much anyone could have said as much .

obama said : i intend to protect a free and open internet , extend its reach to every classroom , and every community , and help folks build the fastest networks , so that the next generation of digital innovators and entrepreneurs have the platform to keep reshaping our world .
obama also pushed for congress to finally pass the legislation we need to better meet the evolving threat of cyber-attacks , combat identity theft , and protect our children 's information .

but he 's been pushing for that for three years , with little success , writes dominic : the white house may have put the speech on medium , joked about obama 's suit choice on twitter and made a nod to instagram but other than that the speech felt out of step with the zeitgeist and failed to add much to the debate now raging in washington over privacy , net neutrality or cybersecurity .

guardian commentator suzanne mcgee takes on the president 's comments about the energy industry which might well , she writes , raise eyebrows : while it 's true that companies have forged ahead to develop shale oil and gas reserves , he 's adroitly avoided the 800 pound elephant in the room : the current response of saudi arabia and other members of the opec cartel to this dramatic event .

on the one hand , obama appears to be celebrating the fact that lower gasoline prices should help the ty family to save $ 750 at the pump , the reason has nothing whatsoever to do with this explosion in us production : it 's thanks to the saudi attempt to squash the us shale energy revolution by flooding the market with cheap crude oil .

this has triggered a massive game of chicken and it remains to be seen just how viable the new american production is at these lower prices , and how long the country will hang on to the status of # 1 world producer .
obama is having his cake while devouring it in these statements : we may be able to have the world 's largest energy industry , but not ultra-low gasoline prices .

obama explains why astronaut scott kelly is in the house : i want americans to win the race for the kinds of discoveries that unleash new jobs converting sunlight into liquid fuel ; creating revolutionary prosthetics , so that a veteran who gave his arms for his country can play catch with his kid ; pushing out into the solar system not just to visit , but to stay .
last month , we launched a new spacecraft as part of a re-energized space program that will send american astronauts to mars .
in two months , to prepare us for those missions , scott kelly will begin a year-long stay in space .
good luck , captain and make sure to instagram it .
a passage in praise of 21st century businesses gets another wave of clapping from team democrat .
let 's set our sights higher than a single oil pipeline , obama says .
21st century businesses need 21st century infrastructure modern ports , stronger bridges , faster trains and the fastest internet .
democrats and republicans used to agree on this .
so let 's set our sights higher than a single oil pipeline .
let 's pass a bipartisan infrastructure plan that could create more than thirty times as many jobs per year , and make this country stronger for decades to come .

guardian commentator suzanne mcgee writes that the president 's lofty words about the country 's proud tradition of leaping in to make sure everyone gets a fair shot are a fair enough description of what the united states has done in the last century or so to try to alleviate the worst poverty and close the most significant wealth gaps .
the problem ?
hanging on to those institutions and making sure they continue to do their work over the long haul , has been a problem .
even the president 's own budget proposals and policies are eating away at medicare benefits ; medicaid and social security are under attack as entitlements .

and to refer to giving citizens post-secondary education is rather entertaining : at best , the country offers students the right to win entrance to some superior colleges , but not necessarily the ability to pay the price , given the sky high debt loads they shoulder at graduation .

as for schools and the nation 's infrastructure , both require a massive overhaul : the estimate cost of keeping superannuated bridges , highways and other structures from collapse , as happened in cincinnati only recently .
vermont 's bernie sanders , an independent senator , calculates that infrastructure improvements alone require $ 1 trillion of new investment .
infrastructure spending and what is still wrong is n't getting much of a mention in the president 's relentless drive to accentuate the positive .

documents.title: obama : 'hire a veteran '
text: the president describes joining forces , a program to help employ veterans : already , we 've made strides towards ensuring that every veteran has access to the highest quality care .

we 're slashing the backlog that had too many veterans waiting years to get the benefits they need , and we 're making it easier for vets to translate their training and experience into civilian jobs .
joining forces , the national campaign launched by michelle and jill biden , has helped nearly 700,000 veterans and military spouses get new jobs .
so to every ceo in america , let me repeat : if you want somebody who 's going to get the job done , hire a veteran .
the president pitches two years of free community college : by the end of this decade , two in three job openings will require some higher education .
two in three .
and yet , we still live in a country where too many bright , striving americans are priced out of the education they need .
it 's not fair to them , and it 's not smart for our future .
that 's why i am sending this congress a bold new plan to lower the cost of community college to zero .
the plan sounds good .
one caveat : the unemployment rate for students with only an associate 's degree is very similar to those with just a high school diploma .
community college dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) tiny , almost imperceptible shake of the head from mitch mcconnell as obama says he is going to ask congress to lower the cost of college .
guardian washington correspondent paul lewis is in the room : to stand , or not to stand ?

he asks : you could see the indecision on the faces of top republican leadership right from the get-go , when barack obama opened his speech with the line tonight , after a breakthrough year for america , our economy is growing and creating jobs at the fastest pace since 1999 and the democratic ranks stoop , whooped and hollered .
the last thing republicans want is to sit through an hour of a democratic president claim credit for americas 's booming economy .
but neither do they want to be caught live on tv impassive at the news of an economy recovery .
it was republican senate leader mitch mcconnell who eventually relented , standing , stone-faced , as the gop legislators lined-up behind him followed suit .
subsequent references to how great the us economy have been met with occasional , albeit reluctant applause from the ranks of the gop .
but you can see the awkwardness on their faces .
paul saw mcconnell wince when obama mentioned the word veto .
award for strangest reaction though goes to newly-elected republican from louisiana , john cassidy .
for some reason he 's taking notes and has spent most of the speech so far with a kind of disbelieving smirk-grin on his face

that applause , in case there was any doubt , is one-sided : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) republicans are sitting stony-faced through an awful lot of this - even the bits they are meant to agree with .

documents.title: obama to congress : 'try it '
text: biggest applause line so far .

obama challenges members of congress to live on the current federal minimum wage : and to everyone in this congress who still refuses to raise the minimum wage , i say this : if you truly believe you could work full-time and support a family on less than $ 15,000 a year , go try it .
if not , vote to give millions of the hardest-working people in america a raise .
the president describes a package to take new action to help states adopt paid leave laws of their own : here 's another example .
today , we 're the only advanced country on earth that does n't guarantee paid sick leave or paid maternity leave to our workers .
forty-three million workers have no paid sick leave .
forty-three million .
think about that .
and that forces too many parents to make the gut-wrenching choice between a paycheck and a sick kid at home .
so i 'll be taking new action to help states adopt paid leave laws of their own .
and since paid sick leave won where it was on the ballot last november , let 's put it to a vote right here in washington .
send me a bill that gives every worker in america the opportunity to earn seven days of paid sick leave .
it 's the right thing to do .

guardian columnist jessica valenti calls the package a tiny amount : let 's hope that this relatively tiny amount of leave as any parent could tell you , six weeks is barely enough time to adjust to your new sleep schedule , let alone having a new human in your life is the beginning of something much larger : a move towards supporting families across the board .

the president offers a definition of middle-class economics : that 's what middle-class economics is the idea that this country does best when everyone gets their fair shot , everyone does their fair share , and everyone plays by the same set of rules .
we do n't just want everyone to share in america 's success we want everyone to contribute to our success .
so what does middle-class economics require in our time ?
the president explains that working in america does n't mean making it america .
because families like rebekah 's still need our help .
she and ben are working as hard as ever , but have to forego vacations and a new car so they can pay off student loans and save for retirement .
basic childcare for jack and henry costs more than their mortgage , and almost as much as a year at the university of minnesota .
like millions of hardworking americans , rebekah is n't asking for a handout , but she is asking that we look for more ways to help families get ahead .
the polling backs him up on this .

despite the new jobs and growth , most americans still say they are falling behind , according to pew research : despite improving views of the economy and job situation , most americans continue to say that they are falling behind the cost of living .

overall , 55 % say their family 's income is falling behind the cost of living , while 37 % say it 's staying about even ; only 6 % think their family income is going up faster than the cost of living .
views on this question have shown no improvement over the course of the last year ; in august 2014 , 56 % said they felt they were falling behind the cost of living .
barack obama delivers his state of the union speech before members of congress in the house chamber of the us capitol .

wong/getty images ( top row ) ( l-r ) victor fugate of kansas city , missouri , dr pranav shetty of washington , judy gross , alan gross , nasas astronaut scott kelly ( bottom row ) astrid muhammad of north carolina , anthony mendez of bronx , new york , first lady michelle obama , rebekah erler of minneapolis , minnesota and dr jill biden .
carr/getty images barack obama stands before giving his state of the union speech before members of congress in the house chamber of the capitol .
wong/getty images

obama deploys the v-word , applying to obamacare , financial regulations and immigration : we ca n't put the security of families at risk by taking away their health insurance , or unraveling the new rules on wall street , or refighting past battles on immigration when we 've got a system to fix .
and if a bill comes to my desk that tries to do any of these things , it will earn my veto .

documents.title: obama : economic 'verdict is clear '
text: obama breaks from the script after a litany of cheerful economic statistics to remark , this is good news , people .
the crowd laughs .
and in the past year alone , about ten million uninsured americans finally gained the security of health coverage .
at every step , we were told our goals were misguided or too ambitious ; that we would crush jobs and explode deficits .
instead , we 've seen the fastest economic growth in over a decade , our deficits cut by two-thirds , a stock market that has doubled , and health care inflation at its lowest rate in fifty years .
so the verdict is clear .
middle-class economics works .
this line gets a low whistle from somebody in the room .
they sounded impressed : and thanks to lower gas prices and higher fuel standards , the ty family this year should save $ 750 at the pump .
obama cinches the analogy with a statistic : 11m new jobs : we believed we could reverse the tide of outsourcing , and draw new jobs to our shores .
and over the past five years , our businesses have created more than 11 million new jobs .
the line gets big applause .
but once again , it does n't tell the whole story : jobs
obama is telling the story of rebekah and ben .
they sacrificed for each other , and slowly , it paid off .
they bought their first home .
they had a second son , henry .
rebekah got a better job , and then a raise .
ben is back in construction and home for dinner every night .
it is amazing , rebekah wrote , what you can bounce back from when you have to¦we are a strong , tight-knit family who has made it through some very , very hard times .
we are a strong , tight-knit family who has made it through some very , very hard times .
the point is to highlight the expanding jobs market .
and unemployment does sit at 5.6 % , at pre-recession levels .
what is often left unsaid , however , is that a lot of those jobs did not pay very well .
it paid off
apparently bruce springsteen also worked on this speech : they were young and in love in america , and it does n't get much better than that .
it begins with our economy .
seven years ago , rebekah and ben erler of minneapolis were newlyweds .
she waited tables .
he worked construction .
their first child , jack , was on the way .
they were young and in love in america , and it does n't get much better than that .
in case you 're counting , that was five rhetorical questions in a row .
( the answer to all of them was yes . )
here 's obama 's first pass at framing the economic choices ahead in terms of inclusion and exclusion : will we accept an economy where only a few of us do spectacularly well ?
or will we commit ourselves to an economy that generates rising incomes and chances for everyone who makes the effort ?
obama refers to this 9/11 generation .

he thanks members of the generation who served in the military , and ends with the big line : and we salute the courage and sacrifice of every man and woman in this 9/11 generation who has served to keep us safe .
we are humbled and grateful for your service .

america , for all that we 've endured ; for all the grit and hard work required to come back ; for all the tasks that lie ahead , know this : the shadow of crisis has passed , and the state of the union is strong .
the first big applause line is about jobs and growth .
tonight , after a breakthrough year for america , our economy is growing and creating jobs at the fastest pace since 1999 .

documents.title: obama begins address
text: we 'll see how closely he sticks to the script : mr speaker , mr vice-president , members of congress , my fellow americans : we are fifteen years into this new century .

fifteen years that dawned with terror touching our shores ; that unfolded with a new generation fighting two long and costly wars ; that saw a vicious recession spread across our nation and the world .
it has been , and still is , a hard time for many .
but tonight , we turn the page .
obama makes it to the lectern .
a last loud whoop goes up .
sounds like they brought in hired clappers .
boehner introduces the president .
once again they 're on their feet and clapping .
obama makes his way down the aisle .
lots of handshakes and hugs .
yup , there 's al green .
mitch mcconnell , the senate majority leader , is visible in the background .
yup , there 's sheila jackson lee .
sustained clapping .
obama is almost up to john kerry now .
there 's jack lew , the treasury secretary .
john roberts , the chief justice .
obama stops to chat with justice stephen breyer , who definitely does n't care about having his taken with the president .

documents.title: obama enters chamber
text: mr speaker !
the president of the united states , calls the sergeant-at-arms .
that applause sounds kind of loud ?
there he is .
# noweta n't .

documents.title: obama to repeat veto threat on iran sanctions
text: as the president speaks , we 'll cut and paste excerpts , appending analysis by our team .
for now we ca n't resist skipping ahead and sampling what he has to say about iran .
last week obama promised to veto any new sanctions before negotiations on iran 's nuclear program were complete .
tonight he again plans to use the word veto : there are no guarantees that negotiations will succeed , and i keep all options on the table to prevent a nuclear iran .

but new sanctions passed by this congress , at this moment in time , will all but guarantee that diplomacy fails alienating america from its allies ; and ensuring that iran starts up its nuclear program again .
it does n't make sense .
that is why i will veto any new sanctions bill that threatens to undo this progress .
the american people expect us to only go to war as a last resort , and i intend to stay true to that wisdom .
here 's what the white house has to say about the unorthodox early release tonight of the full text of the state of the union address .
lest anyone miss how radical this is , they use italics .
and line breaks : there is a ritual on state of the union night in washington .

a little before the address , the white house sends out an embargoed copy of the president 's speech to the press ( embargoed means that the press can see the speech , but they ca n't report on it until a designated time ) .

the reporters then start sending it around town to folks on capitol hill to get their reaction , then those people send it to all their friends , and eventually everyone in washington can read along , but the public remains in the dark .
this year we change that .
for the first time , the white house is making the full text of the speech available to citizens around the country online .
on medium , you can follow along with the speech as you watch in real time , view charts and infographics on key areas , tweet favorite lines , and leave notes .
by making the text available to the public in advance , the white house is continuing efforts to reach a wide online audience and give people a range of ways to consume the speech .
as we expected , further review of the text of tonight 's speech as prepared for delivery confirms the shadow of crisis has passed , and the state of the union is strong .
the video coverage of the activity in the house chamber is now live we 'll keep it there atop the blog through the speech .
there 's the usual hubbub .
outgoing defense secretary chuck hagel is smiling next to outgoing attorney general eric holder .
there 's samantha power , the us ambassador to the un , and white house chief of staff denis mcdonough talking with representative john lewis .

documents.title: obama on 'the events of ferguson '
text: the state of the union address closes with a call to rebuild trust after the events of ferguson and new york .
surely we can understand a father who fears his son ca n't walk home without being harassed , obama is to say : we may have different takes on the events of ferguson and new york .
but surely we can understand a father who fears his son ca n't walk home without being harassed .
surely we can understand the wife who wo n't rest until the police officer she married walks through the front door at the end of his shift .

surely we can agree it 's a good thing that for the first time in 40 years , the crime rate and the incarceration rate have come down together , and use that as a starting point for democrats and republicans , community leaders and law enforcement , to reform america 's criminal justice system so that it protects and serves us all .
that 's a better politics .
that 's how we start rebuilding trust .
that 's how we move this country forward .
that 's what the american people want .
that 's what they deserve .

documents.title: full state of the union text released
text: the white house has , in an unusual move , released the full text of the state of the union address without embargo .
read it here .
breaking : paul ryan shaved ( he showed up for the first day of congress wearing his hunting beard ) .
does this mean he 's reversing the announcement he 's not running for president ?
martha raddatz ( @ martharaddatz ) and great to see rep. paul ryan again !
long time since that debate !

the presidential motorcade has left the white house , according to a pool report : motorcade is rolling from the white house at 8:40 p.m. on a cold , clear night en route to the capitol for the president 's state of the union address .
the first lady is accompanying the president .
from our position in the vans , print pool did not catch a glimpse of the obamas as they left the white house .

documents.title: state of the union in emojis
text: tired of the same old state of the union coverage ?
the guardian us interactive team may have hit on a solution for you .
tonight they will be live-transcribing the state of the union address in emojis .
follow along on our web site here .
and you can follow the project on twitter @ twitterid .
state of the union in emoji guardian

with about 20 minutes to go until the event starts , here 's a summary of where things stand : president barack obama plans to call on congress to authorize force in the fight against isis militants , according to advance excerpts of his state of the union speech .

the president plans to extol the virtues of middle-class economics and present a tax plan that would tap the fortunes of the 1 % to extend credits for child care , education and double-earner families .
tonight , we turn the page , the president plans to say , according to speech excerpts .
the president will also ask congress to legislate new cybersecurity measures , according to the excerpts .
the republican response will agree with the president 's diagnosis of a languishing middle class and call for a simplified tax code .
transportation secretary anthony foxx has been named as designated survivor .
read about the guests who will sit with first lady michelle obama in her viewing box .
guardian washington correspondent dan roberts is in the house chamber .
they just turned the tv lights on , and the temperature in here is rising by about 1 degree per minute ( literally and figuratively ) , dan writes .
for all the talk in washington and tonight 's speech about the middle class , one thing remains unclear : who , exactly , is in the american middle class ?
the guardian asked its readers to tell us what class they believed they belonged to , and why .
over 360 answers poured in .
the general theme : downward economic mobility is real , and it 's a constant risk .
jana kasperkevic ( @ kasperka ) wrote in december : it seems that the only thing keeping many americans out of poverty is a weekly paycheck .
rather than opting to describe themselves as poor , an increasing number of americans describe themselves as lower middle class .
according to pew research center , that number has reached 40 % in 2014 .
lower middle class , or working class , is also a label that over 100 of our readers chose to describe themselves .
read the full piece here .
are you planning to watch tonight 's speech among friends ?
you do n't have to feel bad about having a state of the union watch party .
no matter what syndicated columnist michelle malkin says .
michelle malkin ( @ michellemalkin ) is there a real human being in the world who actually thinks `` # sotu watch party '' sounds like fun ?
iowa representative steve king makes an early play to elevate the discourse , deeming a dream-er invited to sit with first lady michelle obama a deportable .

ana zamora , 21 , an immigrant who arrived in the united states without papers as a child , has travelled from texas to washington for the speech as a representative of the beneficiaries of the 2012 deferred action for childhood arrivals program .
a white house statement says zamora 's parents are potentially eligible to benefit from a further executive action on immigration obama announced in november .
republicans are opposed : steve king ( @ stevekingia ) # obama perverts `` prosecutorial discretion '' by inviting a deportable to sit in place of honor at # sotu w/1st lady .
i should sit with alito .
the president has been wearing a perfectly tasteful navy suit in the run-up to tonight 's big speech scroll through the blog for proof .
will he change ?
senior white house advisor dan pfeiffer playfully tweaks the nation 's deeply divided memories of the news conference last august in which the president appeared in tan .
# yeswetan dan pfeiffer ( @ pfeiffer44 ) the president 's suiting up for the big speech .
tune into at 9pm et # yeswetan
members of congress are beginning to announce who they 've invited as guests for tonight 's speech .

new york senator kirsten gillibrand will host emma sulkowicz , a columbia university student who carried a mattress around campus every day to protest the university 's decision not to expel her alleged rapist .
kirsten gillibrand ( @ sengillibrand ) honored to have emma sulkowicz as my guest to the # sotu tonight : emma 's activism is such an inspiration .
if you had one word to describe the state of the union , what would it be ?
hint : it 's strong .
leo shane iii ( @ leoshane ) what is the state of our union ?
smart money is on `` strong . ''
it 's been that way for last two decades # sotu # sotu2015 ( h/t : @ twitterid )
alan gross spent five years in a cuban prison before a deal was made to release him as part of a plan to normalize us-cuban relations announced by the obama administration last month .

tonight gross and wife judy will sit with the first lady : white house live ( @ whlive ) meet alan & judy gross - heading to watch the state of the union w/ @ twitterid tonight : # sotu ( h/t : @ twitterid )
the white house has named 2015 's designated survivor the cabinet member who will stay away from the capitol while every other high-ranking member of government is inside .
it 's a security measure meant to ensure the viability of the republic .
and tonight , his name is transportation secretary anthony foxx .
that 's him in the middle : transportation secretary anthony foxx .
wilson/getty images does that mean no big highway and bridges infrastructure announcements ?
in the two previous years the energy secretary drew the short straw .

hack 's row , january 2015 : it 's hot ( and ever so slightly fetid ) in here , writes dan roberts , but icy cold in the chamber , where they have turned up the air con ahead of the imminent influx of people and lights .
senator marco rubio of florida offers senator ernst some advice on delivering the republican reply to the state of the union : who thinks this was staged ?
was this staged ?
in any case , here 's the source of the joke , in case you did n't tune in back in '13 : luke brinker ( @ lukebrinker ) never forget .
# sotu ( thanks kayla )
guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) has written a news story about the president 's plan to ask congress to authorise continued military action in the middle east .

the request follows growing criticism that the president 's existing air strikes in iraq and syria lacked the necessary legally underpinning , dan writes : in excerpts from his sixth state of the union speech released early by the white house , the president also suggests that the coalition fight against the islamic state will continue for months if not years to come .

obama 's inclusion of the authorisation for use of military force ( aumf ) call in his speech is the first indication that it will contain new detail on foreign policy , following a heavy advance focus on the economy .
read the full piece here .
house speaker john boehner takes us inside the capitol with a nifty instagram time-lapse ( h/t : @ twitterid )
guardian us finance and economics editor heidi moore ( @ moorehn ) drills down on obama 's planned announcement that middle-class economics works .
make no mistake , writes heidi : this is obama 's attempt to coin a term .
he started promoting middle-out economics , as the journal democracy called it , in earnest on the campaign trail in 2012 .

that term only took root with pundits at think tanks like the center for american progress and the hoover institution and in an analysis in the atlantic , which defined it this way : middle-out economics argues that national prosperity does not trickle down from wealthy businesspeople or corporations ; rather , it flows in a virtuous cycle that starts with a thriving middle class .
middle-out economics demands a systemic policy focus on the skills , capacities , and income of the middle class .
the person who took it viral , however though arguably less so than thomas piketty was venture capitalist nick hanauer , whose ted talk on inequality and middle-out has drawn 1.1m views .

you have to hand it to the president , heidi continues : middle-class economics sounds and works a lot better than trickle-down economics , which calls for the rich to distribute their largesse to the populace and which has been having a miserable year in the shadow of piketty .
still , middle-class economics is nothing new for obama , who has been wooing the middle class since the day he took office , as suzanne mcgee pointed out today .
the rich , she notes , keep getting richer .
some security sweeps are cuter than others .
via guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts :

the parts of obama 's speech about the status of the fight against isis are not winning strong marks for accuracy in early reviews : spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) `` in iraq and syria , american leadership including our military power is stopping isil 's advance . ''
literally false martin hodgson ( @ martinxhodgson ) obama : `` in iraq & syria , american leadership is stopping isil 's advance . ''
message clearly has n't reached iraq & syria
obama meets with four of the letter writers who will join the first lady for the state of the union .
/landov / barcroft media

documents.title: excerpts of republican reply released
text: republicans have released excerpts of a speech to be delivered by senator joni ernst in response to the president 's address .

ernst 's speech coopts some of the president 's stated goals boosting the middle class and creating new economic opportunities but presents the gop as offering solutions : we see our neighbors agonize over stagnant wages and lost jobs .
we see the hurt caused by canceled healthcare plans and higher monthly insurance bills .
we see too many moms and dads put their own dreams on hold while growing more fearful about the kind of future they 'll be able to leave to their children .
americans have been hurting , but when we demanded solutions , too often washington responded with the same stale mindset that led to failed policies like obamacare .
it 's a mindset that gave us political talking points , not serious solutions .
ernst will include a call for a different kind of tax reform : let 's simplify america 's outdated and loophole-ridden tax code .
republicans think tax filing should be easier for you , not just the well-connected .
so let 's iron out loopholes to lower rates and create jobs , not pay for more government spending .
the president has already expressed some support for these kinds of ideas .
we 're calling on him now to cooperate to pass them .
sen. joni ernst , r-iowa rehearses her remarks .

walsh/ap and , in a possible area of overlap with the president , she calls for a comprehensive plan to defeat terrorism : we 've been reminded of terrorism 's reach both at home and abroad ; most recently in france and nigeria , but also in places like canada and australia .
our hearts go out to all the innocent victims of terrorism and their loved ones .
we can only imagine the depth of their grief .
the forces of violence and oppression do n't care about the innocent .
we need a comprehensive plan to defeat them .

documents.title: obama : 'tonight , we turn the page '
text: the president will proclaim a transition away from an era of hard times in the united states , according to speech excerpts : we are fifteen years into this new century .

fifteen years that dawned with terror touching our shores ; that unfolded with a new generation fighting two long and costly wars ; that saw a vicious recession spread across our nation and the world .
it has been , and still is , a hard time for many .
but tonight , we turn the page .

president obama also will ask congress to pass new legislation to better meet the evolving threat of cyber-attacks , according to further advance excerpts of tonight 's speech : no foreign nation , no hacker , should be able to shut down our networks , steal our trade secrets , or invade the privacy of american families , especially our kids .
we are making sure our government integrates intelligence to combat cyber threats , just as we have done to combat terrorism .
and tonight , i urge this congress to finally pass the legislation we need to better meet the evolving threat of cyber-attacks , combat identity theft , and protect our children 's information .
if we do n't act , we 'll leave our nation and our economy vulnerable .
if we do , we can continue to protect the technologies that have unleashed untold opportunities for people around the globe .

documents.title: obama to ask for use-of-force resolution against isis
text: a further excerpt calls for congressional backing for the effort to counter isis militants : in iraq and syria , american leadership including our military power is stopping isil 's advance .
instead of getting dragged into another ground war in the middle east , we are leading a broad coalition , including arab nations , to degrade and ultimately destroy this terrorist group .
we 're also supporting a moderate opposition in syria that can help us in this effort , and assisting people everywhere who stand up to the bankrupt ideology of violent extremism .
this effort will take time .
it will require focus .
but we will succeed .
and tonight , i call on this congress to show the world that we are united in this mission by passing a resolution to authorize the use of force against isil .

documents.title: obama : 'middle-class economics works '
text: digging further into the speech excerpts turns up a phrase with some force of simplicity : middle-class economics works .
: so the verdict is clear .
middle-class economics works .
expanding opportunity works .
and these policies will continue to work , as long as politics do n't get in the way .
[ ] in fact , at every moment of economic change throughout our history , this country has taken bold action to adapt to new circumstances , and to make sure everyone gets a fair shot .
we set up worker protections , social security , medicare , and medicaid to protect ourselves from the harshest adversity .
we gave our citizens schools and colleges , infrastructure and the internet tools they needed to go as far as their effort will take them .
that 's what middle-class economics is the idea that this country does best when everyone gets their fair shot , everyone does their fair share , and everyone plays by the same set of rules .

documents.title: speech excerpts released
text: the white house has released excerpts of tonight 's speech .
as anticipated , the president will call for expanded economic opportunities and more government support for the middle class .

at this moment with a growing economy , shrinking deficits , bustling industry , and booming energy production we have risen from recession freer to write our own future than any other nation on earth .
it 's now up to us to choose who we want to be over the next fifteen years , and for decades to come .
will we accept an economy where only a few of us do spectacularly well ?
or will we commit ourselves to an economy that generates rising incomes and chances for everyone who makes the effort ?
the tax reform proposal the president is set to roll out tonight has already been derided by republicans as a non-starter .
this is not a serious proposal , said a spokesman for paul ryan , chairman of the house ways and means committee .

the plan would raise $ 320bn by changing the way certain big inheritances are taxed ; raising the capital gains tax for top earners and imposing a fee on big financial institutions for borrowing , according to a white house fact sheet .
the cameras in the room should have their work cut out for them to capture the republican reaction to these proposals in real time .
here 's a question : how do you think republicans will react to the president 's new tax plan ?
explosive laughter ?
fit of fainting ?
mild annoyance ?
catatonia ?
let us know in the comments .
anti-tax superhero grover norquist says the proposal is all for show : grover norquist ( @ grovernorquist ) obama 's tax hike `` ideas . ''
one notes he did not pass or even suggest these when dems had control of house/senate in 2009/10 .
all for show .
for newt gingrich , tonight 's a walk down memory lane .
newt gingrich ( @ newtgingrich ) throwback to my first # sotu as speaker in 1995 - 20 years ago this month .
# gop

the national archives approves of this photo said to be of president dwight eisenhower delivering his fifth state of the union : us national archives ( @ usnatarchives ) rt @ twitterid : fascinating view of eisenhower and text as as he gives 1958 # sotu .
# sotuhistory via @ twitterid
we are expecting to have excerpts of the speech in about 10 minutes ( update : nope ) .
meanwhile we wanted to cast a quick glance back at the rich history of the state of the union address .

what we 'll see tonight is prescribed in article 2 of the constitution : [ the president ] shall from time to time give to the congress information of the state of the union , and recommend to their consideration such measures as he shall judge necessary and expedient¦ president woodrow wilson in 1913 established the modern custom of making a speech to congress ; for 100-some years before that they just got a letter .
we 've written elsewhere about the five most influential moments in state of the union history .

here is one that will be really hard for obama to top : james k polk , 5 december 1848 : abundance of gold ' in his fourth annual message , polk announced that the american west was exploding with gold .
the speech drove tens of thousands of prospectors west and put the town of san francisco on the map .

polk said , in part : the accounts of the abundance of gold in that territory are of such an extraordinary character as would scarcely command belief were they not corroborated by the authentic reports of officers in the public service who have visited the mineral district and derived the facts which they detail from personal observation .
it 's unclear whether speaker boehner is relaying the results of his informal twitter poll here to the presidential speechwriters .
if so , the president can be expected to abruptly announce his resignation .
( that wo n't happen . )
speaker john boehner ( @ speakerboehner ) fill in the blank .
the most important thing # potus could say during # sotu is .
p.s .
here 's boehner after last year 's state of the union .
he should look on the bureau of labor statistics web site !
speaker john boehner ( @ speakerboehner ) appreciate what the president said tonight but i 'm w/ those still asking , `` where are the # jobs ? ''

documents.title: preview : the republican reply
text: the republican reply to tonight 's speech will be delivered by freshly minted senator joni ernst of iowa .
the guardian 's rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) has reported a bit on what ernst is about : the freshman senator from iowa may be conservative and combative .
what she is not , most iowans will tell you , is a nut .
or even radical .
the democrats in iowa tried to paint her as a sarah palin clone , but it did n't really work , said tim hagle , a politics professor at the university of iowa .
some of the claims made against her are over the top .
u.s. sen. joni ernst ( r-ia ) practices the republican response .
wilson/getty images representative carlos curbelo , republican of florida , will deliver a version of ernst 's speech in spanish .
that means curbelo could be talking about his experiences as a young girl growing up in iowa , twitter has observed .
last year , the republican rebuttal came from representative cathy mcmorris-rodgers , current chairwoman of the house republican conference , and the year before that it was marco h2o rubio .
the state of the union is heavily armed .
us capitol hill police officers stand guard before tonight 's speech .
downing/reuters

the scene here 's another time-honored state of the union tradition that can be checked off as upheld in 2015 : members of congress camping out in aisle seats for hours to ensure they will be in position to shake the president 's hand on camera when he walks in .
perennial champions at seat-squatting include representative eliot engel of new york , representative sheila jackson lee of texas and representative al green of texas , all democrats .

roll call 's matt fuller counted at least 14 seats saved by midday : matt fuller ( @ mepfuller ) i count at least 14 seats saved for the # sotu , with elijah cummings , barbara lee and karen bass actually sitting in the house chamber .
a security sweep of the chamber is scheduled for 5.30pm , after a legislative session earlier today .
u.s. house history ( @ ushousehistory ) tonight 's # sotu in the house chamber .
here it is 150 years ago .
# sotuhistory more than 30m people watch the speech each year .
last year was a bad one for the president , though ; with 33.3m viewers , it was the least-watched state of the union since 2000 .
it 's 5 o'clock time to meet your guardian 2015 state of the union team .

the blog tonight will include reports and analysis from washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) , washington correspondent paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) , finance and economics editor heidi moore ( @ moorehn ) , national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) , environment correspondent suzanne goldenberg ( @ suzyji ) , tech editor dominic rushe ( @ dominicru ) , chief reporter ed pilkington ( @ edpilkington ) , social news maven kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) , video team mae ryan ( @ maeryan ) and ana terra athayde ( @ anaterrathayde ) , reporters amanda holpuch ( @ holpuch ) , alan yuhas ( @ alanyuhas ) , jana kasperkevic ( @ kasperka ) , and siri srinivas ( @ pjux ) our columnists¦ and more !

documents.title: meet the guests
text: ever since the reagan years , the president and first lady have invited guests to the state of the union whose life stories inform and underscore themes from the speech .

the 23 guests invited to sit in michelle obama 's viewing box this year include a man who spent five years in a cuban prison , an astronaut , a sandwich-chain owner who pays above minimum wage , a union construction worker and a military veteran who lost both legs in afghanistan .
the guardian 's amanda holpuch ( @ holpuch ) has assembled a full report on who 's invited this year .
topping the list is malik bryant , a 13-year-old chicago resident who sent a letter to santa claus asking for safety .

the letter was rerouted to the president 's desk , amanda writes : malik bryant permission bryant 's request could be tied to the racial tensions laid bare between police departments and citizens after the white police officer darren wilson fatally shot the unarmed black teenager michael brown in ferguson , missouri .
as protests grew across the nation , black 12-year-old tamir rice was fatally shot by police in ohio .

what to watch for : many have been calling for obama to make a sweeping public statement about race and police violence , but he has taken a fairly cautious stance in the six month 's since brown 's death .
this could be the moment for long-awaited rhetoric .
read a full rundown of tonight 's guests here .
how the sausage is made tonight 's speech will be the result of a collaboration between the president and chief speechwriter cody keenan .

official white house photographer pete souza tweeted a of the pair working on the speech a couple days ago : petesouza ( @ petesouza ) instagram of president obama working w cody keenan on his state of the union speech in the residence of the wh today more than one internaut has noticed that keenan wears a beard .
the new york times reported tuesday that keenan 's facial hair inspired obama to give him the affectionate nickname of hemingway ' .
we 're not sure what that portends for tonight 's speech .
well there are still a few hours to go who wants to give it a try ?
the state of the union was strong .
people had jobs and they went to them .
they went home and some of them drank .
in other countries the internet was faster but those places were far away .
not everybody had a job .
we know you can top that let 's have it in the comments !
does it matter what the president says ?

a quick glance at states of the union past raises the question of whether the big speech really does anything , apart from attract 30-some million television viewers and create awkward scenes for the internet to make fun of .
obama 's 2013 speech culminated with an emotional call for congress to take a vote on new gun control legislation .
gabby giffords deserves a vote , obama said .
the families of newtown deserve a vote .
the families of aurora deserve a vote .
to hear the hall applaud , it seemed they would get a vote .
instead the legislation fell to a senate filibuster .

as for last year 's state of the union , a pbs study found that obama 's batting average for action taken on specific proposals ended up being.111 : domenico montanaro ( @ domenicopbs ) do n't expect much out of tonight 's # sotu - just 2 of obama 's 18 proposals got through congress

amid all this talk of what the president will talk about , it stands to note that the executive has the power to make certain things happen unilaterally , such as granting federal employees six months ' paid maternity leave or getting the director of nsa in a meeting with google to talk cybersecurity .
other proposals , such as rewriting the tax code , are just words , without the support of congress .

one prominent outstanding question for tonight is how the president will address security concerns following the terror attacks in paris earlier this month and the raids and patrols across europe that followed .

a recent pew research report found that terrorism ranked as the public 's top policy priority for 2015 : pew states ( @ pewstates ) # sotu prep : what americans see as top 2015 priorities via @ twitterid # pewsotu
what will the president say tonight ?
the state of the union is a notoriously overstuffed speech , containing policy prescriptions on every topic the administration wants in the national conversation .
the economic recovery and middle-class mobility will take top billing this year , to hear the white house tell it .
but a handful of additional initiatives are being touted by the president 's press shop as the speech 's big ideas .
they are proposals for two free years of community college ; improved broadband penetration ; enhanced workplace leave ; and bulked-up cybersecurity .
obama spent the last week making appearances to highlight these initiatives .
if you missed the coverage , you can watch a white house propaganda video about it here .
hello and welcome to our live blog coverage of the 2015 state of the union address , which president barack obama is scheduled to deliver in the house chamber beginning at 9pm et .

in the taxonomy of big political speeches inaugurals , convention keynotes , campaign climaxes the state of the union remains its own gloriously unique bird : squawky , large , funky-feathered and usually flightless .
obama enters tonight 's speech , however , with signs of renewed opportunity to point to .
the economy is growing , jobs are returning and gas prices are low .
the affordable care act is on pace to hit new enrollment goals .
the president 's torpid approval rating is even twitching a bit .
now that we have fought our way through the crisis , how do we make sure that everybody in this country is sharing in this growing economy , how do we make sure that they have the tools to succeed ?
the president asks in a video trailer for the speech .
tonight 's most talked-about policy proposal is likely to be a tax reform plan that taps the fortunes of the 1 % for the benefit of middle-class families .
from national security to race relations to climate change , the issues that matter most to americans are all up for discussion and for republican reaction .
we should have advance excerpts of the speech before long , and there 's a lot to discuss meanwhile .
to get started , here 's the white house trailer , which makes it sound a bit as if the president is about to win last year 's nba playoffs .
